prompt: <description>Part 1 Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly angled front face. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.625, 0.0]. This will position the coordinate system for the first sketch. Draw the first sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. This sketch will contain 6 lines. Start by drawing a line from [0.0, 0.0] to [0.625, 0.0], then draw a line from [0.625, 0.0] to [0.625, 0.25]. Next, draw a line from [0.625, 0.25] to [0.25, 0.25], then draw a line from [0.25, 0.25] to [0.25, 0.75]. After that, draw a line from [0.25, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.75], and finally, draw a line from [0.0, 0.75] back to the starting point [0.0, 0.0]. Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter sketch\\_scale, set to 0.75. Transform the sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from Part 1's coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model, using an extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal value of 0.625 and an extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal value of 0.0. Part 2 Construct a smaller rectangular prism. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [180.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.625, 0.625, 0.25]. Draw the second sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. This sketch will contain 4 lines. Start by drawing a line from [0.0, 0.0] to [0.375, 0.0], then draw a line from [0.375, 0.0] to [0.375, 0.5]. Next, draw a line from [0.375, 0.5] to [0.0, 0.5], and finally, draw a line from [0.0, 0.5] back to the starting point [0.0, 0.0]. Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter sketch\\_scale, set to 0.5. Transform the sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from Part 2's coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model, using an extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal value of 0.0 and an extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal value of 0.25. Lastly, perform a join operation with the preceding CAD model (Part 1). The dimensions and shapes of the intermediate parts and the final shape are as follows: * Part 1: A three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and slightly angled front face. The length is 0.75 units, the width is 0.625 units, and the height is 0.75 units. * Part 2: A three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The length is approximately 0.5 units, the width is 0.25 units, and the height is approximately 0.5 units. * Final shape: A three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel to each other and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 1 unit in height.</description>
